meanings.definition: A place that is remote or isolated.
meanings.sent1: The small town was a nowheresville, surrounded by endless fields.
meanings.sent2: The cabin in the woods was in the middle of nowheresville.
meanings.sent3: The lost hikers found themselves in nowheresville, unsure of which way to go.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion stood in nowheresville, hidden from the rest of the world.
meanings.sent5: The desert was a vast nowheresville, with no signs of life around.

meanings.definition: A situation or state of being unimportant or insignificant.
meanings.sent1: His opinion was considered nowheresville in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent2: The typo in the report seemed like a nowheresville mistake.
meanings.sent3: The argument over the color of the curtains felt like a nowheresville issue.
meanings.sent4: Her contribution to the project was nowheresville compared to the others.
meanings.sent5: The small scratch on the car was nowheresville next to the dent.
